conclusion: Determine what happens when objects A and B are placed at the location of objects C, D, E, and F.
Object A is placed at the location of object C.
Object B is placed at the location of object F.
Gravity will cause objects A and B to come into contact with objects C and F, respectively.
If objects A and B are placed directly on top of objects C and F, they will stack on top of them.
If the objects are stable and the surfaces are flat, objects A and B will rest on top of objects C and F.
If the surfaces are uneven or the objects are not stable, they might topple over or slide off.
Assuming the objects are stable and the surfaces are flat, objects A and B will stack on top of objects C and F.
Object A is placed on object C.
Object B is placed on object F.
Gravity will cause A to rest on C and B to rest on F.
If the surfaces are flat and stable, A will stack on C, and B will stack on F.
Objects A and B will stack on top of objects C and F, respectively, due to gravity.
